de.btu.openinfra.backend.rest.project

Class ProjectResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.btu.openinfra.backend.rest.project.ProjectResource

  • @Path(value="/v1/projects")
@Produces(value={"application/json;qs=.5;charset=UTF-8","application/xml;qs=.8;charset=UTF-8"})
@Consumes(value={"application/json","application/xml"})
public class ProjectResource
extends Object
    This class represents the project resource of the REST API. You can access an overview of all available HTTP methods by calling the following link: http://localhost:8080/openinfra_backend/rest/application.wadl The project resource is available by calling the following link: http://localhost:8080/openinfra_backend/rest/projects
    Author:
    BTU DBIS

      • get

        @GET
public List<ProjectPojo> get(@Context
                        javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                        @Context
                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                        @QueryParam(value="language")
                        String language,
                        @QueryParam(value="offset")
                        int offset,
                        @QueryParam(value="size")
                        int size)
        This method provides a list of all projects. The provided parameters are used for paging.
        Parameters:
        offset - the number where to start
        size - the size of items to provide
        Returns:
        a list of projects <= size (window within offset and size)

      • getSubProjects

        @GET
@Path(value="{projectId}/subprojects")
public List<ProjectPojo> getSubProjects(@Context
                                        javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                        @Context
                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                        @QueryParam(value="language")
                                        String language,
                                        @PathParam(value="projectId")
                                        UUID projectId,
                                        @QueryParam(value="offset")
                                        int offset,
                                        @QueryParam(value="size")
                                        int size)
        This method delivers a list of sub projects specified by the current project id in only one hierarchy level.
        Parameters:
        projectId - the id of the current project
        offset - the number where to start
        size - the size of items to provide
        Returns:
        a list of sub projects

      • createProject

        @POST
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createProject(@Context
                                           javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                           @Context
                                           javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                           @QueryParam(value="createEmpty")
                                           boolean createEmpty,
                                           @QueryParam(value="loadInitialData")
                                           boolean loadInitialData,
                                           ProjectPojo project)
        This method creates a new project. You can access this method via curl. An example of the command line could be as follows: curl.exe -X "POST" -H "Content-Type: application/xml" -d @path/to/file http://localhost:8080/openinfra_backend/projects Use the following command to crate an empty schema which is required by the XML import/export interface: curl -i -b cookie.txt -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d
        Parameters:
        project - a project object (JSON or XML representations are converted into real objects via the JAX-RS stack)
        createEmpty - The application creates an empty new schema when true. This is necessary by the external XML interface (XML import/export interface by HTW Dresden)
        loadInitialData - This parameter prerequisites 'createEmpty=true'. There is no initial data stored in the new data base when false. This is required by the XML import/export interface.
        Returns:
        an UUID of the created project

      • updateProject

        @PUT
@Path(value="{projectId}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateProject(@Context
                                               javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                               @Context
                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                               @PathParam(value="projectId")
                                               UUID projectId,
                                               ProjectPojo project)
        Currently, this method should update a project. In contrast to the definition of the HTTP PUT method, this method updates an existing resource and doesn't replace it. This should be discussed/fixed in the future. You can access this method via curl. An example of the command line could be as follows: curl.exe -X "PUT" -H "Content-Type: application/xml" -d @path/to/file http://localhost:8080/openinfra_backend/projects/{id}
        Parameters:
        projectId - the id of project which should be updated
        Returns:
        a response with the specific status

      • deleteProject

        @DELETE
@Path(value="{projectId}")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteProject(@Context
                                                  javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                  @Context
                                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                  @PathParam(value="projectId")
                                                  UUID projectId)
        This method deletes a project resource. You can access this method via curl. An example of the command line could be as follows: curl.exe -I -X "DELETE" http://localhost:8080/openinfra_backend/projects/{id}
        Parameters:
        projectId - the project which should be deleted
        Returns:
        a response with the specific status
